Crimes.Legal_Issue: Assessment of hardship, establishment, and best interests of the children under humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants overstayed visas and sought permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application granted, case remanded for fresh consideration
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Officer inadequately analyzed psychological hardship and conflated risk with hardship
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Psychological assessments, establishment, best interests of children
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Partial evaluation; key psychological evidence not substantively assessed
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permanent residence based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Officers must consider all evidence and not reward unauthorized stays
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to adequately analyze psychological hardship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visas and sought permanent residence on H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Conflation of risk and hardship, insufficient analysis of psychological reports
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Officer reasonably assessed establishment but failed on hardship analysis

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Assessment of hardship, establishment, and best interests of the children under H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Psychological assessments, evidence of long presence and integration

Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to properly assess psychological hardship and conflation with risk
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to H&C decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Psychological assessments were not substantively evaluated

Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient weight given to hardship despite strong establishment

Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Proper application of H&C assessment framework

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refusal of second H&C application after re-entry post-removal

Crimes.Evidence_Type: Psychological assessments, family history, reintegration challenges
